This command teaches your dog to sit down on its haunches. It\'s a fundamental command and is often one of the first commands taught to a dog. It is useful for various situations, such as when you want your dog to remain calm or before crossing the street.

The stay command instructs your dog to remain in a specific position until given further instructions. It\'s crucial for safety and control, especially in situations where you want your dog to stay put, such as when opening a door or crossing a busy road.

The come command is used to call your dog back to you. It is important for getting your dog\'s attention and ensuring they return to you promptly, providing a way to keep your dog close and under control.
Similar to sit, the down command instructs your dog to lie down. This command can be useful in situations where you want your dog to stay in a relaxed position, such as when guests arrive.
Heel is used to have the dog walk close to the owner\'s side without pulling on the leash. It promotes loose-leash walking and better control during walks, ensuring your dog walks calmly beside you.

Would you like to train your dog using clicker training?

Clicker training is a positive reinforcement method that fosters a strong bond between you and your pet. By associating the clicker sound with rewards, you can effectively communicate which behaviors are desired. The immediate reinforcement helps your pet learn quickly and enjoy the training process. With consistency and patience, clicker training can lead to well-behaved pets and a positive training experience for both the animal and the trainer.
